metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: AppML Data
The main purpose of AppML is to provide data to HTML pages.
content.html: The main purpose of AppML is to provide data to HTML pages.

content.text: Connecting AppML to Data
AppML Using a JavaScript Object
A common way to separate HTML and Data, is to store the data in a JavaScript object.
content.html: A common way to separate HTML and Data, is to store the data in a JavaScript object.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
var dataObj = {"records":[
    {"CustomerName":"Alfreds Futterkiste","City":"Berlin","Country":"Germany"},
    {"CustomerName":"Ana Trujillo Emparedados y helados","City":"México D.F.","Country":"Mexico"},
    {"CustomerName":"Antonio Moreno Taquería","City":"México D.F.","Country":"Mexico"},
    {"CustomerName":"Around the Horn","City":"London","Country":"UK"},{"CustomerName":"B's 
    Beverages","City":"London","Country":"UK"},{"CustomerName":"Berglunds 
    snabbköp","City":"Luleå","Country":"Sweden"},{"CustomerName":"Blauer See 
    Delikatessen","City":"Mannheim","Country":"Germany"},{"CustomerName":"Blondel 
    père et fils","City":"Strasbourg","Country":"France"},{"CustomerName":"Bólido 
    Comidas preparadas","City":"Madrid","Country":"Spain"},{"CustomerName":"Bon 
    app'","City":"Marseille","Country":"France"},{"CustomerName":"Bottom-Dollar 
    Marketse","City":"Tsawassen","Country":"Canada"},{"CustomerName":"Cactus 
    Comidas para llevar","City":"Buenos Aires","Country":"Argentina"},{"CustomerName":"Centro 
    comercial Moctezuma","City":"México D.F.","Country":"Mexico"},
    {"CustomerName":"Chop-suey Chinese","City":"Bern","Country":"Switzerland"},
    {"CustomerName":"Comércio Mineiro","City":"São Paulo","Country":"Brazil"}]};

content.code:
Customer City Country
{{CustomerName}} {{City}} {{Country}}

syntax_highlighting.text:
var dataObj = {"records":[
    {"CustomerName":"Alfreds Futterkiste","City":"Berlin","Country":"Germany"},
    {"CustomerName":"Ana Trujillo Emparedados y helados","City":"México D.F.","Country":"Mexico"},
    {"CustomerName":"Antonio Moreno Taquería","City":"México D.F.","Country":"Mexico"},
    {"CustomerName":"Around the Horn","City":"London","Country":"UK"},{"CustomerName":"B's 
    Beverages","City":"London","Country":"UK"},{"CustomerName":"Berglunds 
    snabbköp","City":"Luleå","Country":"Sweden"},{"CustomerName":"Blauer See 
    Delikatessen","City":"Mannheim","Country":"Germany"},{"CustomerName":"Blondel 
    père et fils","City":"Strasbourg","Country":"France"},{"CustomerName":"Bólido 
    Comidas preparadas","City":"Madrid","Country":"Spain"},{"CustomerName":"Bon 
    app'","City":"Marseille","Country":"France"},{"CustomerName":"Bottom-Dollar 
    Marketse","City":"Tsawassen","Country":"Canada"},{"CustomerName":"Cactus 
    Comidas para llevar","City":"Buenos Aires","Country":"Argentina"},{"CustomerName":"Centro 
    comercial Moctezuma","City":"México D.F.","Country":"Mexico"},
    {"CustomerName":"Chop-suey Chinese","City":"Bern","Country":"Switzerland"},
    {"CustomerName":"Comércio Mineiro","City":"São Paulo","Country":"Brazil"}]};

content.code_html:
<table appml-data="dataObj">
<tr>
  <th>Customer</th>
  <th>City</th>
  <th>Country</th>
</tr>
<tr appml-repeat="records">
  <td>{{CustomerName}}</td>
  <td>{{City}}</td>
  <td>{{Country}}</td>
</tr>
</table>

<script>
var dataObj = {
"records":[
{"CustomerName":"Alfreds Futterkiste","City":"Berlin","Country":"Germany"},
{"CustomerName":"Ana Trujillo Emparedados y helados","City":"México D.F.","Country":"Mexico"},
{"CustomerName":"Antonio Moreno Taquería","City":"México D.F.","Country":"Mexico"},
{"CustomerName":"Around the Horn","City":"London","Country":"UK"},
{"CustomerName":"B's Beverages","City":"London","Country":"UK"},
{"CustomerName":"Berglunds snabbköp","City":"Luleå","Country":"Sweden"},
{"CustomerName":"Blauer See Delikatessen","City":"Mannheim","Country":"Germany"},
{"CustomerName":"Blondel père et fils","City":"Strasbourg","Country":"France"},
{"CustomerName":"Bólido Comidas preparadas","City":"Madrid","Country":"Spain"},
{"CustomerName":"Bon app'","City":"Marseille","Country":"France"},
{"CustomerName":"Bottom-Dollar Marketse","City":"Tsawassen","Country":"Canada"},
{"CustomerName":"Cactus Comidas para llevar","City":"Buenos Aires","Country":"Argentina"},
{"CustomerName":"Centro comercial Moctezuma","City":"México D.F.","Country":"Mexico"},
{"CustomerName":"Chop-suey Chinese","City":"Bern","Country":"Switzerland"},
{"CustomerName":"Comércio Mineiro","City":"São Paulo","Country":"Brazil"}
]};
</script>

content.text: AppML Using a JSON File
Another common way to separate HTML and Data, is to store the data in a JSON file:
content.html: Another common way to separate HTML and Data, is to store the data in a JSON file:

content.code:
{

"records":[

{"CustomerName":"Alfreds Futterkiste","City":"Berlin","Country":"Germany"},

content.text: With AppML, you can specify a JSON file as the data source in the appml-data attribute:
content.html: With AppML, you can specify a JSON file as the data source in the appml-data attribute:

content.code_html:
<table appml-data="customers.js">
<tr>
  <th>Customer</th>
  <th>City</th>
  <th>Country</th>
</tr>
<tr appml-repeat="records">
  <td>{{CustomerName}}</td>
  <td>{{City}}</td>
  <td>{{Country}}</td>
</tr>
</table>

content.text: AppML Using a Database
With a little help from a web server, you can feed your application with SQL data.
content.html: With a little help from a web server, you can feed your application with SQL data.

content.text: This example uses PHP to read data from a MySQL database:
content.html: This example uses PHP to read data from a MySQL database:

content.code_html:
<table appml-data="https://www.w3schools.com/appml/customers.php">
<tr>
  <th>Customer</th>
  <th>City</th>
  <th>Country</th>
</tr>
<tr appml-repeat="records">
  <td>{{CustomerName}}</td>
  <td>{{City}}</td>
  <td>{{Country}}</td>
</tr>
</table>

content.text: The Power of AppML
You are about to discover the power of AppML.
content.html: You are about to discover the power of AppML.

content.text: AppML can provide you with data, controllers, and models for:
content.html: AppML can provide you with data, controllers, and models for:

content.text: You can put as many AppML applications as you like inside an HTML page.
content.html: You can put as many AppML applications as you like inside an HTML page.

content.text: AppML does not interfere with other parts of the page.
content.html: AppML does not interfere with other parts of the page.

content.text: You have full HTML, CSS, and JavaScript freedom.
content.html: You have full HTML, CSS, and JavaScript freedom.

content.text: AppML can be used to develop full scale CRUD web applications.
content.html: AppML can be used to develop full scale CRUD web applications.

content.text: CRUD: C reate, R ead, U pdate, D elete.
To discover the power of AppML: View an AppML Demo .
content.html: To discover the power of AppML: View an AppML Demo.
